question: when did the legal drinking age changed to 21
vanilla_rag_result: The legal drinking age was changed to 21 in the United States in response to the National Minimum Drinking Age Act, which was enacted in 1984. States were required to raise their minimum purchasing age to 21 by October 1986 to avoid losing federal highway funds. By mid-1988, all 50 states and the District of Columbia had complied with this mandate.
